Articles.Content:
It still hasn't been got I'm afraid.

Clue: It's not anything specifically military.

Paint?

I'm too tired for this.
Glue? Caulking? Heat?
Metal? It could rust in the water and pollute.
Still no, and 10char.
Um... well, were we on the right track with environmental concerns?
One clue per day, I think

Politics?

I hate the 10char limit.

/\

Because you can definitely shove politics into a gun...

"Political power grows out of the barrel of a gun." - Mao Zedong.

My riddle's not politics though. Lol, it seemed obvious when I wrote it, but evidently it's not so simple.
Fire? it seems not obvious to us

Oil?

(this is my last hope)

Nope, and I guess it's time for another clue, in the form of an extension to the riddle.

In the ocean or a lake,

Protests and questions are all I'll make,

But in a tank or from a gun,

The war I'll ensure will be won.

In far-flung countries I am grown,

Shipped round the world for you to own.

Food?

10chars

Oh oh oh! I think I have another good guess!

Is it lead? Well. The last two lines don't fit it at all. But the first 4 it fits really well. And, China does have a rep of using lead paint. So the last 2 lines sort of fit. I don't know.
Endersmens has GOT to be the winner. If he isn't right, i suggest we all give up, and declare the person closest to the answer the next riddler.

Endersmens has GOT to be the winner. If he isn't right, i suggest we all give up, and declare the person closest to the answer the next riddler.

You give up too easily.

Yeah, lead really doesn't fit with the 5th line anyways. You can't grow lead.

I hate it when guesses fit so perfectly with all but one line.

Still not guessed. Good thinking with lead, but yeah, the extra two lines nix that idea.

Next clue in about 18 hours anyway.

Edited September 10, 2014 by cantab

Is it plastic? Plastic is organic, but processed. I think.

No, wait, what about rubber?

Plastic isn't organic. It's refined petroleum. Bioplastic is a thing, though. Made by combining glucose molecules, if I recall correctly.

Hmmmmmmmm... I need to think on this more... Smoke? Fire? Ash?

hmmm. Sulfur crossed my mind, but I doubt it. I was thinking excess sulfur in water is bad, and sulfur is a main ingredient in gunpowder, and most explosives. And there's chinese fireworks, shipped to other countries for people to set off. But I can't see the 5th line fitting sulfur either. Gah. That fifth line is refusing all my guesses!

Nope, and I guess it's time for another clue, in the form of an extension to the riddle.

In the ocean or a lake,

Protests and questions are all I'll make,

But in a tank or from a gun,

The war I'll ensure will be won.

In far-flung countries I am grown,

Shipped round the world for you to own.

Just reposting this. Still no more guesses for me, sticking with plastic (or bioplastic, on Vexx's continuation) or rubber.

EDIT: Also, as this is a riddle, "grown" does not necessarily mean "organic". It could mean "built" or "manufactured".

Just reposting this. Still no more guesses for me, sticking with plastic (or bioplastic, on Vexx's continuation) or rubber.

EDIT: Also, as this is a riddle, "grown" does not necessarily mean "organic". It could mean "built" or "manufactured".

Well, lead can be manufactured and he said the "grown" part didn't fit it so I assumed he really meant grown.

Could. I said could...

Hmm... "But in a tank or from a gun". Not IN a gun. Possible important word difference? Or just fancy wording?

People go in tanks... But they don't come from guns, and as far as I know, we don't own slaves anymore.

What comes out of a gun and is in a tank? It still seems like bullets. Or shells. But shells in a lake shouldn't raise protests, if they are just normal animal shells.

Argh, confusing riddles.
